revisions.rev:
{{cleanup-linkrot|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox artist discography | Artist = [[The Stooges]] | Image = Stooges Milan '06.jpg | Image size = 200px | Caption = The Stooges performing in [[Milan]], Italy on September 2, 2006 | Studio = 4 | Studio link = Studio albums | Live = 7 | Live link = Live albums | Compilation = 4 | comp link = Compilation albums | 1Option = 3 | 1Option name = Box sets | 1Option link = Box sets | 1Option color= #00EE00 | Singles = 24 | Singles link = Singles | 2Option = 2 | 2Option name = Guest appearances | 2Option link = Guest appearances | 2Option color= #FFA500 | References = yes }} The [[discography]] of [[The Stooges]], a [[Detroit, Michigan|Detroit]], [[Michigan]] based [[Rock music|rock]] band founded by "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music#Male titles|The Godfather of Punk Music]]" [[Iggy Pop]] as singer, [[Ron Asheton]] as guitarist, [[Dave Alexander (The Stooges)|Dave Alexander]] as bass-guitarist and [[Scott Asheton]] as drummer, currently consists of four [[studio album]]s, twenty-four [[Single (music)|singles]], four [[live album]]s, and three [[box set]]s. The Stooges debut album ''[[The Stooges (album)|The Stooges]]'' was released on August 5, 1969 in the [[United States]] and one month later in the [[United Kingdom]]. The album wasn't a huge commercial success — it did chart in the [[Billboard 200|Billboard 200 charts]] on 106. One year later, on August 1970, the band released the album ''[[Fun House (The Stooges album)|Fun House]]'', which didn't chart either in the Billboard 200, or in the [[UK Album Chart]] and any other international music album chart. In 1973 the Stooges released the album ''[[Raw Power]]''. It charted in the Billboard 200 at 182, in the [[United Kingdom]] at least at 44 and is the best charted The Stooges album in the United Kingdom to date. After the release of their third album the Stooges announced the break-up of the band, who were also known at the time as Iggy Pop & The Stooges. The Stooges reunited thirty-four years after their official dissolution and released ''[[The Weirdness]]''. Although the album was the best-charted album in the United States by peaking at number 130, its overall commercial charting is similar to that of the Stooges' first three albums. Despite being a commercial failure (none of their albums has received a certification), the Stooges are described by critics as one of the key bands of [[Punk rock|Punk music]] and their genre is described as "[[Proto-Punk]]", an early form of punk rock. Many musicians, especially punk music bands, as well as artists like [[Kurt Cobain]],{{cite book|author = Cobain, Kurt|title = Journals| publisher = Riverhead Hardcover|year = 2002|isbn = 978-1573222327}} cited the Stooges as a huge influence. == Studio albums == {| class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"|Year !rowspan="2"|Title !colspan="2"|Chart Positions |- !width="50"|[[Billboard 200|U.S.]] !width="50"|[[UK Album Chart|U.K.]] |- || 1969 | '''''[[The Stooges (album)|The Stooges]]''''' *Released: August 5, 1969 ([[United States|U.S.]]), September 1969 ([[United Kingdom|UK]]) *Label: [[Elektra Records]] | style="text-align:center;"| 106 | style="text-align:center;"| — |- || 1970 | '''''[[Fun House (The Stooges album)|Fun House]]''''' *Released: July 7, 1970 *Label: Elektra | style="text-align:center;"| — | style="text-align:center;"| — |- || 1973 | '''''[[Raw Power]]''''' * as 'Iggy and The Stooges' *Released: February 7, 1973 (U.S.), June 1973 (UK) *Label: [[Columbia Records]] | style="text-align:center;"| 182 | style="text-align:center;"| 44 |- || 2007 | '''''[[The Weirdness]]''''' *Released: March 6, 2007 *Label: Virgin | style="text-align:center;"| 130http://www.billboard.com/#/album/the-stooges/the-weirdness/896804 | style="text-align:center;"| 81 |} == Live albums == {| class="wikitable" |- !|Year !|Title |- || 1976 | '''''[[Metallic K.O.]]''''' *Label: Skydog Records |- || 1988 | '''''[[Live at Whiskey A Go-Go]]''''' *Label: Revenge Records |- || 1995 | '''''[[Open Up and Bleed]]''''' *Label: [[Bomp Records]] |- || 1997 | '''''California Bleeding''''' *Label: Bomp Records |- || 2003 | '''''[[Live in Detroit (The Stooges album)|Live in Detroit]]''''' *Label: |- || 2005 | '''''[[Telluric Chaos]]''''' *Released: May 3, 2005 *Label: Skydog Records |- || 2007 | '''''[[Escaped Maniacs]]''''' *Released: 2007. *Label: ABC Entertainment and Charley Films. |- || 2009 | '''''[[You Don't Want My Name... You Want My Action]]''''' *Label: Easy Action |- ||2010 | '''''[[Have Some Fun: Live at Unganos]] *Label: [[Rhino Records|Rhino]] |- || 2011 | '''''[[Raw Power Live: In the Hands of the Fans]]''''' *Label: MDV. |} == Compilations == {| class="wikitable" |- !|Year !|Title |- || 1995 | '''''[[Rough Power]]''''' *Label: Bomp Records *Notes: Original mixes of ''[[Raw Power]]'' |- || 1997 | '''''Year Of The Iguana''''' *Label: Bomp Records |- || 2006 | '''''Original Punks''''' *Label: Music Club Deluxe |- || 2009 | '''''More Power''''' *Label: Cleopatra Records *Notes: 2 CDs |} == Box sets == {| class="wikitable" |- !|Year !|Title |- || 1991 | '''''[[Night of Destruction]]''''' *Label: Revenge Records |- || 1999 | '''''[[1970: The Complete Fun House Sessions]]''''' *Label: [[Rhino Entertainment]] |- || 2005 | '''''[[Heavy Liquid]]''''' *Label: Easy Action Records |} == Guest appearances == *'''''[[Skull Ring]]''''' by [[Iggy Pop]] November 4, 2003 ([[United States|US]])

(Revenge, 1990), France * "Till The End Of The Night" b/w "I'm Sick Of You" (Revenge, 1990), France * "She Creatures Of Hollywood Hills" b/w "Tight Pants" b/w "Jesus Loves The Stooges" (Revenge, 1990), France * "Open Up And Bleed" studio version b/w "I Got A Right" b/w "Gimme Some Skin" (Revenge, 1990), France * "Nowhere", a version of "Born In A Trailer" b/w "Consolation Prizes" b/w "Johanna" (Revenge, 1990), France * "I'm Sick Of You" b/w "Tight Pants" b/w "She Creatures Of Hollywood Hills" (Melodia, Soviet Union), 1990 * "I Got A Right" b/w "Gimme Some Skin" (Bomp, 1990), US * "I Got Nothing" b/w "Cock In My Pocket" (Jungle, 1998), UK * "Gimme Danger" b/w "Heavy Liquid" (Munster, 1999), Spain * "Search And Destroy" b/w "Penetration" (Sundazed reissue, 2005) * "[[Free & Freaky]]" (Virgin, 2007) == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{MySpace|iggyandthestooges}} * {{Allmusic|p143693|The Stooges}} {{The Stooges}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stooges}} [[Category:The Stooges albums| ]] [[Category:Discographies of American artists]] [[Category:Punk rock groups discographies|Stooges, The]] [[it:Discografia dei The Stooges]] [[pl:Dyskografia The Stooges]]
